subject: Creativity
title: Multitasking Kills Creativity: Mostly True, With One Exception
description: A quick win: understand Multitasking Kills Creativity: Mostly True, With One Exception.

hook.text: Multitasking reduces cognitive performance by 40%. Except for one type: working on MULTIPLE creative projects.

buildup.text: Rapid task-switching (email + writing + calls) devastates deep creative work.

discovery.text: But working on 2-3 creative projects in PARALLEL (not simultaneously) helps.

twist.text: Darwin worked on multiple books at once. Einstein juggled physics problems.

climax.text: The key distinction: multi-TASKING (rapid switching) kills creativity.

punchline.text: Don't multitask. Do multi-project. The difference is the speed of switching.

quiz.question: What's the difference between multitasking and multi-project working?
options: Multitasking (rapid switching) kills creativity; multi-project (parallel exploration) enhances it
Multi-project working is just slower multitasking
